source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Onagraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Onagraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems little-branched; inflorescences lacking glandular hairs; leaves narrowly ovate to ovate, margins densely serrulate, teeth 16–40 each side
Stems usually well-branched; inflorescences with or without glandular hairs; leaves linear or lanceolate to narrowly ovate, margins coarsely serrate or serrulate, teeth 1–20 each side
Leaves linear to narrowly ovate, margins coarsely serrate, teeth 1–6 each side
Leaves lanceolate to narrowly ovate, margins serrulate, teeth 4–20 each side
Leaves lanceolate to narrowly ovate, margins not undulate, teeth shallow, regular, 4–12 each side (montane areas in damp places)
Leaves usually lanceolate, margins often undulate, teeth small, dense, irregular, 6–20 each side
